item.title: Exploring R & RStudio
item.description:
• R & RStudio?
  • Installing R & RStudio
    • Window Users
    • Mac Users
  • Opneing RStudio

R & RStudio?

Let us remember that R and RStudio are two distinctly different applications that serve different purposes. R is the software that performs the actual instructions. It’s the workhorse. Without R installed on your computer, you would not be able to run any commands. RStudio is a software that provides an nifty interface to R.

Installing R & RStudio

To get started with R & RStudio, you need to acquire your own copy. Here, I will show you how to download it. Follow the link that describes your operating system: Windows or Mac.

Window Users

To install R

  • Open an internet browser and go to www.r-project.org.
  • Click the “download R” link in the middle of the page under “Getting Started.”
  • Select a CRAN location (a mirror site) and click the corresponding link.
  • Click on the “Download R for Windows” link at the top of the page.
  • Click on the “install R for the first time” link at the top of the page.
  • Click “Download R for Windows” and save the executable file somewhere on your computer. Run the .exe file and follow the installation instructions.
  • Now that R is installed, you need to download and install RStudio.

To install RStudio

  • Go to (www.rstudio.com)[www.rstudio.com].
  • Click on [Download] (https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/) and then “Download” under “RStudio Desktop”.
  • Click “Download RStudio for Mac” to get the latest Windows version; save the .dmg file on your computer; double-click it to open; and then drag and drop it to your applications folder.

Mac Users

To install R

  • Open an internet browser and go to www.r-project.org.
  • Click the “download R” link in the middle of the page under “Getting Started.”
  • Select a CRAN location (a mirror site) and click the corresponding link.
  • Click on the “Download R for macOS” link at the top of the page.
  • Click on the file containing the latest version of R, as appropriate for your hardware.
  • Save the .pkg file, double-click it to open, and follow the installation instructions.
  • Now that R is installed, you need to download and install RStudio.

To install RStudio

  • Go to (www.rstudio.com)[www.rstudio.com].
  • Click on [Download] (https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/) and then “Download” under “RStudio Desktop”.
  • Click “Download RStudio for Mac” to get the latest Mac version; save the .dmg file on your computer; double-click it to open; and then drag and drop it to your applications folder.

Opneing RStudio

When you open RStudio, a window appears with three panes in it.

RStudio IDE for R in Mac

The largest pane is a console window. This is where you’ll run your R code and see results. The console window is exactly what you’d see if you ran R. Everything else you see is unique to RStudio. Hidden in the other panes are a text editor, a graphics window, a debugger, a file manager, and much more.
